title: Ray Williams (weightlifter)
text:
Raymond Williams (born 9 September 1959 in <a href="Holyhead">Holyhead</a>, <a href="North%20Wales">North Wales</a>) is a <a href="Wales">Welsh</a> weightlifter.
Williams was voted Young Welsh Sports Personality of the Year in 1977 after being placed in the junior weightlifting championships. He joined the <a href="British%20Army">army</a> and served with the <a href="Royal%20Welch%20Fusiliers">Royal Welch Fusiliers</a> until 2003. 
Returning to the sport, Williams won the Welsh weightlifting championships in 1983 and the Celtic Nations title the following year. 
Williams won the gold medal in the featherweight class at the <a href="1986%20Commonwealth%20Games">1986 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>, beating David Lowenstein of <a href="Australia">Australia</a> and <a href="Jeffrey%20Brice">Jeffrey Brice</a>, a fellow Welshman. 
In 2003, Williams was appointed as the first National Weightlifting Coach for <a href="Wales">Wales</a>.
